title: Emitted electron between metals X and Y

content.question: A photon with energy <math alttext="4 electron volts" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext>eV</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is incident on metal <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>X</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, which has a work function of <math alttext="3 electron volts" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext>eV</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. Metal <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>X</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is electrically connected to metal <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> through a <math alttext="2 volts" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext>V</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> voltage supply with the polarity shown in the figure above. What is the maximum kinetic energy an emitted electron could have when it reaches metal <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
